content:
As a product designer, I would recommend starting with the design phase of your electric motorbike project. This will involve defining the features and specifications of your product and creating a visual representation of what it will look like. Here are some specific steps you can follow:

1. Define your target market: Determine who your ideal customers are and what they are looking for in an electric motorbike. This will help you tailor your design to meet their needs and preferences.
2. Research the competition: Look at what other electric motorbikes are available in the market and identify any unique features or characteristics that set them apart. This will help you determine what you can do differently or better with your own product.
3. Define your product's features and specifications: Determine the specific features and specifications of your electric motorbike, such as the type of battery, motor, and frame you'll use, as well as any additional features you want to include.
4. Create a concept sketch: Use a sketch or drawing program to create a visual representation of your electric motorbike. This will help you visualize what your product will look like and make it easier to communicate your ideas to others.
5. Refine your design: Iterate on your design based on feedback from potential customers and other stakeholders, such as engineers or manufacturers.

By following these steps, you can create a well-designed electric motorbike that meets the needs of your target market.
